DataElement.preferredName: Arm and Breast Symptom Questionnaire 23 Past 7 Days Extent Breast Cancer Treatment Disrupted Social Activities with Family and Friends Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation to what extent, in the past 7 days, the effect of breast cancer treatment on their arm has disrupted social activities with family and friends, using a 5-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Arm and Breast Symptom Questionnaire Past Week Extent Breast Cancer Treatment Disrupted Social Activities with Family and Friends Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the elbow. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole superior limb._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest._Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient._Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument._The most recent week, including today._A question about to what extent an individual's breast cancer treatment has disrupted their social activities with family and friends._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the elbow. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole superior limb.

Concepts.longName: Extent Breast Cancer Treatment Disrupted Social Activities with Family and Friends

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 11/26/18 TT released/CWinch. Created for CCTG MA.39 - smt 4/4/2018

ValueDomain.preferredName: Arm and Breast Symptom Questionnaire Disrupted 5 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 1 (not at all difficult) to 5 (Unable to do) on a 5-point Likert scale.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is or was not at all disrupted.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is or was not at all disrupted.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is or was a little disrupted.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is or was a little disrupted.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is or was somewhat disrupted.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is or was somewhat disrupted.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is or was quite a bit disrupted.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is or was quite a bit disrupted.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that aspects of an individual's life are or were very much disrupted.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that aspects of an individual's life are or were very much disrupted.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
